name: Ethical Decision-Making
description: Just Culture, LOAC, and professional conduct drills for Guardian leaders.

cards.title: Just Culture Triage
cards.description: Apply the USAF Just Culture decision tree (human error, at-risk, reckless) to a recent console error. Ref: AFI 90-301.
cards.summaryText: Just Culture keeps learning high and fear low when used weekly.

cards.title: LOAC in Space Vignette
cards.description: War-game a scenario applying Law of Armed Conflict principles (military necessity, proportionality, distinction) to a space control COA. Ref: DoDD 2311.01E.
cards.summaryText: Space operations still follow LOAC—practice the translation.

cards.title: Ethical Risk Matrix
cards.description: Overlay mission risk and ethical risk on a 2x2 matrix before approving expedited actions. Ref: AFDP 1-1 Risk Management.
cards.summaryText: Seeing ethical risk visually prevents rash approvals.

cards.title: Whistleblower Path Review
cards.description: Brief your team on protected communication channels and reprisal protections outlined in DoDI 7050.01. Ref: DoDI 7050.01.
cards.summaryText: Guardians speak up faster when they know they're protected.

cards.title: Information Classification Drill
cards.description: Have crews classify sample mission data using classification guides to avoid over/under-marking. Ref: DoDM 5200.01 Vol 2.
cards.summaryText: Accurate markings protect sources without slowing the fight.

cards.title: Professional Boundaries Scenario
cards.description: Role-play handling fraternization or misuse of government resources using AFI 1-1 standards. Ref: AFI 1-1.
cards.summaryText: Leaders must intervene early and consistently on conduct issues.

cards.title: Moral Courage Reflection
cards.description: Write about a time you delayed voicing concern and plan how you'd respond aligned with the Guardian Creed. Ref: Guardian Ideal.
cards.summaryText: Reflection builds the courage to speak up next time.

cards.title: Ethics Advisory Council
cards.description: Stand up a quarterly mini-council with legal, chaplain, and senior enlisted advisors to review upcoming dilemmas. Ref: Commander’s Inspection Program.
cards.summaryText: Diverse perspectives sharpen ethical calls before they hit crisis mode.

cards.title: Command Climate Pulse
cards.description: Use DEOCS micro-surveys to check respect, inclusion, and workload fairness metrics quarterly. Ref: DoDI 6400.11.
cards.summaryText: Ethical climates are measured, not assumed.

cards.title: Integrity First Story Bank
cards.description: Collect real stories from your unit that illustrate Integrity First and share them during hail & farewell events. Ref: AF Core Values Handbook.
cards.summaryText: Stories make ethics tangible for new Guardians.

cards.title: Ethical Decision Log
cards.description: Maintain a log of high-stakes decisions noting context, stakeholders, and principles applied. Ref: AFDP 1-1.
cards.summaryText: Logs aid transparency and accelerate learning for successors.

cards.title: Ethics Scenario Sandbox
cards.description: Use tabletop scenarios blending operational urgency with ethical tension; grade using AFI 1-1 checklists. Ref: OTS Capstone.
cards.summaryText: Tabletops inoculate leaders before the real dilemma arrives.
